pr_title: #2150 Change the rules for how a constructor for mapping is picked

timeline.message:
#2150 Change the rules for how a constructor for mapping is picked

New rules:

1. Constructor annotated with @Default (from any package) has highest precedence
2. If there is a single public constructor then it would be used to construct the object
3. If a parameterless constructor exists then it would be used to construct the object, and the other constructors will be ignored

timeline.bodyText: Should we also allow friendly and protected?  I guess we have some logic somewhere to detect these scenarios...
timeline.author: sjaakd

replies.bodyText: We do allow protected ones. Those are part of the accessibleConstructors. This is to have public constructors with e precedence, so we can check them first.
replies.author: filiphr
